chapter.title: What Is &sles4sap;?

abstract.para: &sles4sapreg; is a bundle of software and services that addresses the specific needs of SAP users. It is the only operating system that is optimized for all SAP software solutions.

listitem.para: Unix to Linux migrations and replatforming

chapter.para: &sles4sap; consists of software components and service offerings which are described in the following sections. The figure shows an overview of which software components and services are also available with other products from &suse; (green) and which are exclusively available with &sles4sap; (blue).

sect1.title: Software Repository Setup
sect1.para: Software included with operating systems based on &sle; are delivered as RPM packages, a form of installation package that can have dependencies on other packages. On a server or an installation medium, these packages are stored in software repositories (sometimes also called channels).
sect1.remark: FIXME: "variant" is maybe not a good word... - sknorr, 2016-06-17
sect1.para: By default, computers running &productname; are set up to receive packages from multiple repositories. Of each of the standard repositories, there is a Pool variant that represents the state of the software when it was first shipped. There is also an Update variant that includes the newest maintenance updates for the software in the Pool variant.

Depending on your installation method, you may also see SLE-12-SP2-SAP-12.2-0 which is the installation medium. It contains packages from all of the base software repositories listed above.
Having own repositories for &productname; allows shipping packages and patches that are specific to &productname;.

listitem.para: &sles4sap; includes Extended Service Pack Overlap Support which extends the overlap between the support periods of two consecutive service packs by one year. Within this period, you remain under full support and receive all relevant maintenance updates. As a standard offering, this is unique.

Extended Service Pack Overlap Support allows you to perform service pack migrations within 18 months instead of only 6 months. Migrations can be scheduled more easily and testing before a migration can be performed under lesser time constraints.

At additional cost, &suse; also offers Long Term Service Pack Support (LTSS). With LTSS, you receive support for a particular service pack after ESPOS has run out. For more information about the life cycle of &suse; products, see:
General explanation: Book Deployment Guide, Part Updating and Upgrading &sle;, Chapter Life Cycle and Support (&docaddress;)

term.emphasis: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server Priority Support for SAP Applications

listitem.para: Subscriptions for &sles4sap; include SUSE Linux Enterprise Server Priority Support for SAP Applications which offers technical support for &sles4sap; directly from SAP. The joint support infrastructure, used by support engineers from &suse; Technical Support and SAP, is based upon SAP Solution Manager and offers a seamless communication with both SAP and &suse;. This One Face to the Customer support model reduces complexity and lowers the total cost of ownership.
For more information, see SAP Note 1056161: SUSE Priority Support for SAP Applications ().
